title: 2015 Malaysia Premier League
text:
The 2015 Liga Premier () was the 12th season of the <a href="Liga%20Premier">Liga Premier</a>, the second-tier professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> league in Malaysia.
The season was held from January and concluded in August 2015.
The <a href="Liga%20Premier">Liga Premier</a> champions for 2015 season was <a href="Kedah%20FA">Kedah</a>. The champions and runners-up were both promoted to <a href="2016%20Liga%20Super">2016 Liga Super</a>.
Changes from last season.
Team changes.
To Liga Super.
Promoted from <a href="2014%20Liga%20Premier">2014 Liga Premier</a>
Relegated from <a href="2014%20Liga%20Super">2014 Liga Super</a>
From Liga FAM.
Relegated to <a href="2015%20Malaysia%20FAM%20League">2015 Liga FAM</a>
Promoted to 2015 Liga Premier
Teams.
A total of 12 teams are contesting the league, including 8 sides from the 2014 season, two promoted from the <a href="2014%20Malaysia%20FAM%20League">2014 Malaysia FAM League</a> and two relegated from <a href="2014%20Liga%20Super">2014 Liga Super</a>.
On 27 May 2014, <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur%20FA">Kuala Lumpur</a> earned promotion from the <a href="2014%20Malaysia%20FAM%20League">2014 Malaysia FAM League</a>. They returned to the second division after being absent for a year. This was followed by <a href="Kuantan%20FA">Kuantan</a>. The two teams replace <a href="Perlis%20FA">Perlis</a> and <a href="PBAPP%20F.C.">PBAPP</a> who were all relegated to the 2015 Liga FAM.
<a href="T-Team%20F.C.">T-Team</a> and <a href="PKNS%20F.C.">PKNS</a> were relegated from <a href="2014%20Liga%20Super">2014 Liga Super</a>. They are replacing <a href="PDRM%20FA">PDRM</a> and <a href="Felda%20United%20F.C.">Felda United</a> who get promotion to <a href="2015%20Liga%20Super">2015 Liga Super</a>.
Team summaries.
Foreign players.
The number of foreign players is restricted to four per Malaysian League team. A team can use four foreign players on the field in each game, including at least one player from the <a href="Asian%20Football%20Confederation">AFC</a> country.
